content:
# EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining Setup at Position(41.0, -82.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (41.0, -82.0) facing down
- Wooden chest at (41.5, -80.5) containing 230 coal
- Burner inserter at (41.5, -79.5) moving items from drill to chest

### Iron Ore Mining and Smelting Setup at Position(-18.0, -53.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (-18.0, -53.0) facing down
- Input wooden chest at (-17.5, -51.5)
- Input burner inserter at (-16.5, -51.5) facing right
- Stone furnace at (-15.0, -51.0)
- Output burner inserter at (-13.5, -50.5) facing right
- Output wooden chest at (-12.5, -50.5) containing 804 iron plates

### Transport Belt Network
Multiple belt groups forming transport paths throughout the map. All belt groups are currently empty and not actively transporting items. The network spans:
- Horizontal belt sections at various y-levels (-54.5 to -1.5)
- Vertical belt sections connecting different y-levels
- Multiple parallel belt lines forming pathways
- Belt groups connecting various production areas

# ERROR TIPS

### Errors with Entity Placement
- Always check if a tile is occupied before placing new entities
- Remove existing entities before trying to place new ones at the same position
- When placing entities next to each other, verify there is enough space and no blocking entities

### Errors with Item Insertion
- Verify required items (like coal or materials) are in inventory before attempting insertion
- Keep track of fuel levels in burner devices

### Errors with Belt Systems
- Plan belt connections carefully to avoid placement conflicts
- Ensure you have enough transport belts in inventory before attempting to connect distant entities
- Remove problematic or unused belt sections before attempting new belt layouts

### Entity Connection Errors
- Verify space availability and clear path when connecting entities
- Consider spacing parameters when placing entities next to each other
- Check for blocking entities in the connection path

### General Tips
- Keep track of inventory contents before performing operations
- Monitor fuel levels in all burner devices to maintain operation
- Clean up unused or blocking entities before new construction
- Verify entity positions and orientations when modifying existing structures
